creator: krzysztof.kacki@gmail.com
text:
When i use  FilseMatch to limit the scope of the Header set directive, it always impact *.png files.
<FilesMatch "\.html$">
Header set Cache-Control: "must-revalidate, pre-check=0, post-check=0, max-age=0"
</FilesMatch>
Filtering works ok, when I replace FilesMatch with following:
<Files ~"\.html$">
Header set Cache-Control: "must-revalidate, pre-check=0, post-check=0, max-age=0"
</Files>
attach complete config and logs with %{Cache-Control}o and %f
creator: covener@gmail.com
krzysztof.kacki@gmail.com
text:
After I spend some time on the problem, it turned out that it was my fault. When I looked to the server logs, I found out, that not cached png files where requested by css, files and they produces 404.
My 404 html was catched by FilesMatch correctly. Unfortunately 404 issue was not reported by FireBug.
Sorry for spamming.
